name: Mercy Virtual Care Center
description:
Before getting a test, you need to call Mercy’s COVID-19 Clinical Support Line at 314-251-0500.

“We will only provide screening for those who meet these requirements because testing prior to the appearance of symptoms can result in a false negative,” Dr. Keith Starke said. “It’s critical for our communities that we screen those with the highest risk.”

name: Washington Fairgrounds
description: The Washington test site will be located on the Washington Fairgrounds, 6 Fairgrounds Rd. Washington, MO, 63090. The site will be near the Mercy First Aid Building and the Motorsports Arena. It is scheduled to open on Monday, March 23.

name: Mercy - MetLife building
description: The South St. Louis County site will be located in the parking lot of the MetLife building at 13045 Tesson Ferry Rd., St. Louis, MO, 63128. It is scheduled to open on Wednesday, March 25.

name: Hillsboro Community Civic Club Jefferson County Fairgrounds
alternate_name: Hillsboro Community Civic Club Jefferson County Fairgrounds
description: The Hillsboro site will be located at the Hillsboro Community Civic Club Jefferson County Fairgrounds at 10349 Business 21, Hillsboro, MO, 63050. An opening date for this site is to be determined.

name: Memorial Hospital in cooperation with St. Clair County Health Department
alternate_name: Memorial Hospital in cooperation with St. Clair County Health Department
description:
Before going to the collection site, people must contact their primary care physician who will work with the local health departments to prescreen and validate if you need to come to the specimen collection site.

A press release said if you have not completed the prescreening process, please do not come to the specimen collection site. You cannot have a specimen collected without prior evaluation by your physician and authorization from the local health department.

name: St. Luke's Hospital
description:
The facility is on the parking lot between the Mr. and Mrs. Theodore P. Desloge, Jr. Outpatient Center, Building B and St. Luke’s Resource Center which is directly west across Highway 141 from the hospital’s main campus.

The testing facility will be for patients that have a written order for COVID-19 testing from a St. Luke's Medical Staff provider. Once the patient gets the written order, they can call 314-966-9107 to set up an appointment time. The facility will be open from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Friday.

name: Affinia Healthcare
description: Affinia Healthcare announced it’ll provide a COVID-19 testing station in north St. Louis. It’ll be at its 1717 Biddle St. location and open on April 2.
